intro: Solanum vaccinioides, commonly known as the dwarf nightshade, is a perennial shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant features small, green leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when ripe. The plant has a short stature, typically growing to about 30 cm in height, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a ground cover.
